summary: This is a U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List, generated on April 6, 2021, detailing 22 travel records for an individual from 1997 to 2016. The document shows international flights primarily between the United States (LAX, JFK, RDU) and the United Kingdom (LHR, LGW), with records indicating passenger status and APIS (Advanced Passenger Information System) checks. It is marked as confidential and part of the SDNY Epstein case materials.

persons.name: Kimberly Meder
persons.context: Listed as the person who generated this TECS Person Encounter List on April 6, 2021.

events.title: Earliest Recorded Flight
events.description: An airline record (not APIS) is logged, marking the earliest entry in this travel history.

events.title: Most Recent Recorded Flight
events.description: A flight from LAX to an unspecified location, with APIS status 'NOT ON', is recorded as the most recent entry.

events.title: TECS List Generation
events.description: U.S. Customs and Border Protection generates this confidential Person Encounter List, compiling historical travel data.

keyFacts: The document is a confidential law enforcement travel record (TECS Person Encounter List) associated with the SDNY Epstein case (SDNY_GM_02753142/3).
It contains 22 travel records for an individual spanning from 1997 to 2016, with flights primarily between the U.S. (LAX, JFK, RDU) and the UK (LHR, LGW).
The subject's travel was monitored via the Advanced Passenger Information System (APIS), with some entries flagged as 'NOT ON' the system.
The list was generated by CBP Officer Kimberly Meder on April 6, 2021, indicating ongoing investigative review of travel patterns.
The document does not name the subject of the travel records; the individual's identity is redacted or not included in this excerpt.
